cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Jacksonville, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast, expected to make landfall near the SC/NC border tonight, then track quickly up the Mid-Atlantic coast toward the Chesapeake Bay and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northeastern South Carolina / southern North Carolina coast (between South Santee River SC and Surf City NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Watch Hill RI to Stonington ME including Martha’s Vineyard, Nantucket and Block Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from north of Surf City NC to west of Watch Hill RI including Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Delaware Bay, Long Island and Long Island Sound; Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Surf City NC; Storm-Surge Warnings Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from South Carolina through New England, including the Chesapeake and Delaware Bays
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–55 mph with gusts to 60 mph) possible Tuesday as the center passes just east of the bay; 12 % chance of sustained 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC surge guidance indicates 1–3 ft of inundation possible north of Cape Hatteras to Cape May, including the Chesapeake Bay – this includes Baltimore’s approaches at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts up to 8 inches expected across the Mid-Atlantic; flash and urban flooding likely in the Baltimore metro area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat Tuesday; dangerous rip currents on Chesapeake tributaries; possible short-notice channel restrictions due to debris and elevated currents.
